definitions.definition: The act of producing , making or creating something.
examples: The widget making machine is being used for production now.

definitions.definition: The act of bringing something forward, out, etc., for use or consideration.

examples: The widgets are coming out of production now.
They hope to increase spaghetti production next year.

definitions.definition: The presentation of a theatrical work.
examples: We went to a production of Hamlet.

definitions.definition: An occasion or activity made more complicated than necessary .
examples: He made a simple meal into a huge production .

definitions.definition: That which is manufactured or is ready for manufacturing in volume (as opposed to a prototype or conceptual model ).
examples: This is the final production model.

definitions.definition: The act of lengthening out or prolonging .
A rewrite rule specifying a symbol substitution that can be recursively performed to generate new symbol sequences. (More information on Wikipedia .)
examples: Each production is implemented with a function.

definitions.definition: The environment where finished code runs, as opposed to staging or development .
Written documents produced in support of the action or defence.

Writing viewed as the process of producing a text in any medium (written, spoken, signed, multimodal, nonverbal), consisting of several steps such as conceptualization, formulation, expression and revision.

main_definition: The act of producing , making or creating something. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: The act of bringing something forward, out, etc., for use or consideration. [from 15th c.]
The presentation of a theatrical work.
An occasion or activity made more complicated than necessary .
That which is manufactured or is ready for manufacturing in volume (as opposed to a prototype or conceptual model ).
The act of lengthening out or prolonging .
( computing ) A rewrite rule specifying a symbol substitution that can be recursively performed to generate new symbol sequences. (More information on Wikipedia .)
( programming , uncountable ) The environment where finished code runs, as opposed to staging or development .
( Scots law , in the plural ) Written documents produced in support of the action or defence.

( linguistics ) Writing viewed as the process of producing a text in any medium (written, spoken, signed, multimodal, nonverbal), consisting of several steps such as conceptualization, formulation, expression and revision.
